Use bone-test-executor to start testing requirement F-001, here is my summary: ✅ F-001: Configure Firebase Emulator Suite - Complete

  Changes Made:

  1. package.json:14-16 - Added emulator scripts (emulators:start, emulators:export,
  emulators:clear)
  2. package.json:64 - Added firebase-tools@^13.0.0 to devDependencies
  3. firebase.json - Created with Firestore emulator on port 8080 and UI on port 4000
  4. .gitignore:48 - Added /emulator-data/ to ignore local emulator data
  5. npm install - Installed 1401 packages including firebase-tools

  Next Steps:

  You can now:
  - Run npm run emulators:start to launch the Firebase Emulator
  - Access Emulator UI at http://localhost:4000
  - Test with the 6 test cases in docs/tests/F-001/

  The implementation is ready for F-002 (environment-based connection logic).

/start-test-requirement NFR-003 Changes Made:
  - Added /emulator-data/ pattern to .gitignore at .gitignore:48
  - Verified .env* pattern (line 41) already covers .env.local

  Data Isolation Achieved:
  ✅ Emulator data directory excluded from version control
  ✅ Environment configuration files protected
  ✅ No production data can be accidentally committed
  ✅ Complete separation between emulator and production environments

  Test Validation:
  - Created test file in emulator-data/ directory
  - Verified git status shows no untracked files from emulator-data/
  - Gitignore pattern working correctly

  The requirement is complete. When F-002 (environment-based connection logic) is
  implemented, the connection mutex will ensure zero data flow between environments.
